world_news:
• [Nov 25, 8:00 AM] Ukraine Conflict: A drone and missile attack on Kyiv, Ukraine, resulted in the deaths of six people and caused significant disruptions to the city's energy supply.
  • [Nov 25, 4:10 PM] Israel-Hamas Conflict: Despite a recent ceasefire agreement, fighting between the Israeli military and Hamas has continued, leading to further casualties on both sides.
  • [Nov 24, 11:00 PM] Brazil Politics: Brazil's highest court has ordered former President Jair Bolsonaro to begin serving his sentence at a police station for his involvement in a coup plot.
  • [Nov 25, 4:00 AM] Louvre Robbery Arrest: French police have arrested an individual suspected of being the fourth member of the gang responsible for the robbery at the Louvre Museum.
  • [Nov 25, 12:00 AM] Ethiopian Volcano: Ash from the eruption of the Hayli Gubbi volcano in Ethiopia has led to the cancellation of flights by Indian air carriers.
  • [Nov 25, 11:00 AM] EU Court Ruling: The European Court of Justice has ordered Poland to legally recognize same-sex marriages that have been performed in other EU countries.
  • [Nov 25, 11:30 AM] US-Japan Relations: The leaders of the United States and Japan held a phone call to discuss relations, marking their first conversation since the recent downturn in Japan-China relations.
us_news:
• [Nov 25, 2:00 PM] US-Venezuela Relations: The US has designated the Venezuelan criminal organization 'Cartel de los Soles' as a Foreign Terrorist Organization. The move is intended to increase pressure on the Maduro regime, which the US accuses of corruption and human rights abuses.
  • [Nov 25, 1:45 PM] Healthcare Costs: The Biden administration is expected to announce lower prices for 15 high-cost prescription drugs for Medicare recipients later this week. This is part of the ongoing implementation of the Inflation Reduction Act's drug price negotiation provisions.
  • [Nov 25, 11:30 AM] Military Activity: The Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Gen. Dan Caine, is visiting US troops in the Caribbean. The visit is seen as a move to increase pressure on Venezuela and counter drug trafficking in the region.
  • [Nov 25, 10:00 AM] Tech Regulation: A bipartisan group of senators introduced a new bill aimed at regulating artificial intelligence. The bill focuses on ensuring the safety and transparency of AI systems developed and deployed in the US.
  • [Nov 24, 5:00 PM] Economy: The Federal Reserve released minutes from its latest meeting, indicating a cautious approach to future interest rate hikes. The central bank is monitoring inflation and employment data closely before making its next move.
  • [Nov 24, 3:15 PM] Infrastructure: The Department of Transportation announced a new round of funding for high-speed rail projects across the country. The investment aims to improve connectivity and reduce carbon emissions.
  • [Nov 24, 1:00 PM] Supreme Court: The Supreme Court heard arguments in a major case concerning social media and free speech. The case could have significant implications for how online platforms moderate content.
tech_news:
• [Nov 25, 12:11 PM] Microsoft's AI Copilot to Exit WhatsApp: Microsoft announced that its AI chatbot, Copilot, will no longer be available on WhatsApp starting January 15, 2026, due to new platform policies by the messaging service that restrict general-purpose AI chatbots.
  • [Nov 25, 11:14 AM] AI Locates Major Lithium Deposit: Fleet Space, a space exploration technology company, reported the discovery of a significant lithium deposit in Quebec, Canada. The finding was made possible by the company's AI-powered satellite technology, which analyzes subsurface data to locate valuable minerals.
  • [Nov 25, 10:15 AM] Spotify Price Hike Coming: Spotify is planning to increase the prices of its subscription plans in the United States in the first quarter of 2026. This move follows pressure from major record labels to increase payouts to artists and rightsholders.
  • [Nov 24, 5:27 PM] OpenAI Faces Trademark Issue: OpenAI is facing a potential trademark dispute with the celebrity video messaging service Cameo. The issue is over the use of the word "cameo" in OpenAI's Sora video generation app, as Cameo holds a trademark for the term.
  • [Nov 24, 9:03 AM] Malaysia Considers Social Media Ban for Minors: The Malaysian government is considering a ban on social media access for users under the age of 16. The country's communications minister stated that the administration is exploring age verification systems to implement the restriction.
  • [Nov 24, 7:30 AM] Rocket Lab's Neutron Delays: In an interview, Rocket Lab's CEO, Peter Beck, discussed the delays in the development of the company's larger Neutron rocket. He also commented on the success of Blue Origin's New Glenn and the importance of NASA's role in inspiring the public.
financial_news:
• [Nov 25, 4:30 PM] US Stocks Close Higher on Positive Economic Data: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq saw gains of 1.2% and 1.8% respectively, closing the trading day on a positive note. The rally was fueled by a better-than-expected consumer confidence report released earlier in the day, suggesting robust consumer spending heading into the holiday season.
  • [Nov 25, 2:15 PM] European Markets End Mixed as Investors Weigh Central Bank Signals: The FTSE 100 closed down 0.5%, while the DAX gained 0.3%. Investors are digesting recent commentary from ECB officials, hinting at a cautious approach to further rate cuts amid persistent, though easing, inflation.
  • [Nov 25, 11:00 AM] Bitcoin Volatility Increases Ahead of Options Expiry: Bitcoin's price saw a sharp 4% swing, dropping to $78,000 before recovering to $81,200. The heightened volatility is attributed to the upcoming expiration of a large batch of options contracts at the end of the week.
  • [Nov 25, 10:05 AM] Tech Stocks Rally on AI Chip News: Major technology shares, including Nvidia and AMD, surged after a key industry report forecasted stronger-than-expected demand for AI chips in the coming year. The news lifted the entire semiconductor sector.
  • [Nov 25, 8:30 AM] US Consumer Confidence Surges Unexpectedly: The Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index jumped to its highest level in six months, a positive sign for the economic outlook. The report indicated that consumers are more optimistic about both present conditions and future expectations.
  • [Nov 25, 5:00 AM] Reuters Analysis on European Wealth Taxes: A Reuters report published this morning examines the consequences of wealth taxes in Norway, noting a trend of millionaires leaving the country. The analysis discusses the potential implications for other European nations considering similar tax policies.
  • [Nov 24, 11:45 PM] Bank for International Settlements (BIS) Appoints New Head of Digital Assets: The BIS announced late last night the appointment of a new head for its growing digital asset and cryptocurrency division, signaling a continued focus on the integration of digital currencies into the global financial system.
conspiracies:
• [Nov 25, 12:19 PM] Theory: California Governor Gavin Newsom references conspiracies spread by Robert F. Kennedy Jr., following a CDC website language change that allegedly suggests a link between vaccines and autism. The theory posits a government cover-up of vaccine-related health issues.
  • [Nov 24, 3:39 PM] Theory: The FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3) is being spoofed by malicious actors to steal personal information and money. The theory suggests this could be a sophisticated operation to undermine the agency or target specific individuals.
  • [Nov 21, 1:16 PM] Theory: Joe Rogan promotes a documentary, 'The Age of Disclosure,' claiming that high-ranking government officials are finally revealing the truth about alien encounters and recovered extraterrestrial spacecraft.
  • [Nov 19, 2:59 PM] Theory: On his podcast, Bill Simmons discusses a scale of NBA-related conspiracies, including the theory that the 2016 NBA Finals outcome was influenced by the league's suspension of Draymond Green.
  • [Nov 12, 12:54 PM] Theory: A theory, shared by Joe Rogan, claims that the SV40 virus is linked to a secret government bioweapon program that was deployed in 2021.
  • [Nov 12, 12:40 PM] Theory: Information is being suppressed regarding the potential collapse of the Atlantic Ocean current, which, according to a post shared by Joe Rogan, Iceland has declared a national security risk capable of causing a new ice age.
  • [Oct 21, 1:23 AM] Theory: A theory, highlighted by Joe Rogan, suggests that California Governor Gavin Newsom engaged in a corrupt deal by signing a bill that allows a utility company to use state wildfire funds to pay for its liabilities.
